Speaker: Harry Potter
Dialogue: Stay close.

Dialogue: Now where?

Dialogue: I don't understand. In my dream, the doors weren't identical.

Dialogue: Well, let's try a few.

Dialogue: Yeah. I'll know the way when I see it.

Dialogue: Who's there?

Dialogue: Sirius?

Dialogue: There's no one here, Harry. This isn't the right room.

Dialogue: Does anyone else hear that?

Dialogue: Harry…

Dialogue: Harry, I think we should leave.

Dialogue: Harry, we're here for Sirius, remember?

Speaker: Harry Potter
Dialogue: Sirius...yeah…

Speaker: Harry Potter
Dialogue: Alohomora!

Dialogue: Whatever's in there, the Ministry sure doesn't want anyone getting to it.

Speaker: Harry Potter
Dialogue: This is it! Come on!

Speaker: Harry Potter
Dialogue: This is it. This is where Sirius is!

Speaker: Harry Potter
Dialogue: He's in here somewhere.

Speaker: Hermione Granger
Dialogue: I don't think Sirius is here.

Dialogue: Harry, have you seen this?

Dialogue: Er...it's got your name on it.

Speaker: Harry Potter
Dialogue: What's my name doing here?

Speaker: Hermione Granger
Dialogue: Don't touch it, Harry!

Speaker: Harry Potter
Dialogue: Why not?

Speaker: Neville Longbottom
Dialogue: Yeah, Harry, don't.

Speaker: Harry Potter
Dialogue: It's got my name on it!

Dialogue: I warned you before that one day you would come to a sticky end, Potter.

Speaker: Harry Potter
Dialogue: Where's Sirius?

Speaker: Lucius Malfoy
Dialogue: We don't have him, if that's what you mean.

Speaker: Harry Potter
Dialogue: You never did, did you? It was all just a trick.

Speaker: Lucius Malfoy
Dialogue: The Dark Lord knows your weakness for heroics, Potter. All it took was a little nudge to get you here.

Speaker: Lucius Malfoy
Dialogue: Now give me that prophesy.

Speaker: Harry Potter
Dialogue: What prophesy?

Speaker: Lucius Malfoy
Dialogue: That prophesy. Now hand it over or we'll have to use wands on you.

Speaker: Harry Potter
Dialogue: Go ahead.

Speaker: Lucius Malfoy
Dialogue: Very brave of you, Potter. Or are you foolish?

Speaker: Harry Potter
Dialogue: Come and find out!

Speaker: Lucius Malfoy
Dialogue: Really, Potter. You expect to defeat all of us with your little school friends? Now hand it over, and they won't have to die here.

Speaker: Bellatrix Lestrange
Dialogue: I haven't escaped from Azkaban for this!

Speaker: Lucius Malfoy
Dialogue: No! If the prophesy is smashed--

Speaker: Bellatrix Lestrange
Dialogue: Take the youngest girl. We'll see how committed Potter is as we torture her.

Speaker: Harry Potter
Dialogue: You even try to take her and I'll smash this thing.

Speaker: Harry Potter
Dialogue: So, what kind of prophesy are we talking about here?

Speaker: Bellatrix Lestrange
Dialogue: Surely you jest, Potter?

Speaker: Harry Potter
Dialogue: Not really. How come Voldemort wants it?

Speaker: Lucius Malfoy
Dialogue: You dare to speak the Dark Lord's name?

Speaker: Harry Potter
Dialogue: Who, Voldemort? Oh, yeah, I dare. Voldemort, Voldemort, Voldemort- -

Speaker: Bellatrix Lestrange
Dialogue: Silence! How dare you utter that name from your half—-blood mouth!

Speaker: Harry Potter
Dialogue: Hey, did you know Voldemort's a half-blood too?

Speaker: Lucius Malfoy
Dialogue: Control yourself, Bellatrix!

Speaker: Harry Potter
Dialogue: What's so special about this

Speaker: Lucius Malfoy
Dialogue: You mean Dumbledore never told you the reason you bear that scar was hidden here?

Speaker: Harry Potter
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: Harry Potter
Dialogue: When I give the signal, blast the shelves…

Speaker: Lucius Malfoy
Dialogue: So that's what took you so long. We wondered.

Speaker: Harry Potter
Dialogue: But why did he need me to take it?

Speaker: Lucius Malfoy
Dialogue: Only a person for whom the prophesy was made can remove it from its self, Potter, and the Dark Lord certainly couldn't get it himself.

Speaker: Harry Potter
Dialogue: So he used me to do his dirty work, did he?

Speaker: Harry Potter
Dialogue: Now!

Speaker: Harry Potter
Dialogue: RUN!

Speaker: Hermione Granger
Dialogue: Stupify!

Speaker: Lucius Malfoy
Dialogue: Stop them!

Speaker: Hermione Granger
Dialogue: Colloportus!

Dialogue: Where'd the rest go?

Dialogue: Harry, they went the wrong way!

Dialogue: They might have gone on to the hall.

Dialogue: Check under the desks.

Dialogue: Avada-—

Dialogue: Expelliarmus!

Speaker: Harry Potter
Dialogue: Stupify!

Dialogue: Ron!

Dialogue: Impedimenta!

Dialogue: We've got him!

Dialogue: Silenco! Stupify!

Speaker: Harry Potter
Dialogue: Pretificus Totalus!

Speaker: Neville Longbottom
Dialogue: Stupify!

Speaker: Harry Potter
Dialogue: Hermione!

Dialogue: Please don't be dead, please don't be dead...

Speaker: Harry Potter
Dialogue: Hermione, wake up…

Dialogue: What's they do to her?

Speaker: Neville Longbottom
Dialogue: She's alive, Harry. There's a pulse.

Dialogue: Can we carry her?

Speaker: Neville Longbottom
Dialogue: I'll do it. You're better at fighting.

Speaker: Neville Longbottom
Dialogue: Where do we go?

Speaker: Harry Potter
Dialogue: I don't know...

Speaker: Harry Potter
Dialogue: What happened.

Speaker: Ginny Weasley
Dialogue: I think my ankle's broken. And somebody hit Ron with a weird spell...

Speaker: Ron Weasley
Dialogue: Hiyya, Harry.

Speaker: Ron Weasley
Dialogue: You look funny….

Speaker: Luna Lovegood
Dialogue: They hit her with something too.

Speaker: Harry Potter
Dialogue: We need to get out of here. Luna, can you help Ginny?

Speaker: Bellatrix Lestrange
Dialogue: There they are!

Speaker: Lucius Malfoy
Dialogue: Your race is run, Potter. Hand it over.

Speaker: Harry Potter
Dialogue: Let my friends go and I will.

Speaker: Lucius Malfoy
Dialogue: You are not in a position to negotiate.

Speaker: Neville Longbottom
Dialogue: Don't do it, Harry! Don't!

Speaker: Harry Potter
Dialogue: Stop, Neville!

Speaker: Bellatrix Lestrange
Dialogue: Neville? Neville Longbottom?

Speaker: Bellatrix Lestrange
Dialogue: My dear boy, I paid your parents a visit a long time ago. We had such a time!

Speaker: Neville Longbottom
Dialogue: You put them in St. Mungos!

Speaker: Bellatrix Lestrange
Dialogue: So, Potter. Give us the Prophesy or I'll see how long it takes to crack Longbottom like his parents.

Speaker: Neville Longbottom
Dialogue: Don't give it to them!

Speaker: Bellatrix Lestrange
Dialogue: Crucio!

Speaker: Harry Potter
Dialogue: Are you all right?

Speaker: Neville Longbottom
Dialogue: Yeah...

Dialogue: Give me the prophesy!

Dialogue: Get out of here, you two!

Speaker: Sirius Black
Dialogue: That will take you back out of the Department of Mysteries.

Speaker: Harry Potter
Dialogue: You come with us!

Speaker: Sirius Black
Dialogue: You're the important one, now, Harry. I have to help the Order.

Speaker: Sirius Black
Dialogue: I'll always be here for you, Harry. Now go!

Speaker: Sirius Black
Dialogue: Hello, cousin!

Speaker: Lucius Malfoy
Dialogue: Potter!

Dialogue: We may have lost the prophesy, but I can still deliver you to the Dark Lord!

Dialogue: Stupify!

Dialogue: Protego!

Dialogue: It's Dumbledore!

Dialogue: Is that the best you've got, cousin?

Speaker: Harry Potter
Dialogue: Sirius!

Speaker: Harry Potter
Dialogue: Let me go!

Speaker: Remus Lupin
Dialogue: Harry! HARRY!...he's gone...there's nothing you can do...

Speaker: Harry Potter
Dialogue: LIAR!

Dialogue: Harry, no!

Dialogue: You can't stop me, Potter!

Speaker: Harry Potter
Dialogue: I'LL KILL you!!

Speaker: Harry Potter
Dialogue: Stupify!

Dialogue: Come out, come out, Potter...

Dialogue: Well, well, have you come to avenge your dear Godfather?

Speaker: Harry Potter
Dialogue: Crucio!

Speaker: Bellatrix Lestrange
Dialogue: Crucio!

Dialogue: Never used an Unforgivable Curse before, have you, Potter? You have to mean it, you have to want to cause the pain in your very soul...

Dialogue: Give me the prophesy!

Dialogue: Can't. It got smashed by accident!

Speaker: Bellatrix Lestrange
Dialogue: You lie!

Dialogue: How's Voldemort going to like that? You've failed him, and he's not very forgiving, is he?

Speaker: Bellatrix Lestrange
Dialogue: Forgive me, Master! I tried, I--

Speaker: Harry Potter
Dialogue: He can't hear you from here, you know!

Dialogue: Can't I, Potter?

Speaker: Voldemort
Dialogue: So, you smashed my prophesy...

Speaker: Voldemort
Dialogue: I grow tired of you continually thwarting my plans, Harry Potter!

Speaker: Voldemort
Dialogue: Avada Kadavra!

Speaker: Albus Dumbledore
Dialogue: You should not have come here tonight, Tom.

Speaker: Voldemort
Dialogue: It is you who made that mistake, Dumbledore!

Speaker: Voldemort
Dialogue: Avada Kedavra!

Speaker: Voldemort
Dialogue: You do not seek to kill me, Dumbledore?

Speaker: Albus Dumbledore
Dialogue: There are other ways to destroy a man, Tom.

Speaker: Voldemort
Dialogue: There is nothing worse than death!

Speaker: Albus Dumbledore
Dialogue: You are quite wrong, Tom, as you have always been.

Speaker: Harry Potter
Dialogue: Look out!

Speaker: Harry Potter
Dialogue: Professor!

Speaker: Albus Dumbledore
Dialogue: Stay where you are, Harry!

Speaker: Harry Potter
Dialogue: Kill me now, Dumbledore… do it, if death means nothing...

Speaker: Albus Dumbledore
Dialogue: Harry!

Dialogue: Are you all right, Harry?

Dialogue: Minister, I saw him! You-Know-Who! He was right there!

Speaker: Cornelius Fudge
Dialogue: I know...I saw him too...

Speaker: Albus Dumbledore
Dialogue: If you and your men will proceed to the Death Room, you will find several Death Eaters which I and some others have apprehended.

Speaker: Cornelius Fudge
Dialogue: Seize him!

Speaker: Albus Dumbledore
Dialogue: Minister, you have just seen You- Know-Who in the flesh only seconds ago! It is time to come to your senses!

Speaker: Albus Dumbledore
Dialogue: If you insist on trying to arrest me, I am perfectly willing demonstrate how useless such an attempt will be.

Speaker: Cornelius Fudge
Dialogue: Dumbledore, what the blazes happened here?

Speaker: Albus Dumbledore
Dialogue: I will explain everything, Minister. Just as soon as I return Harry to school.

Speaker: Cornelius Fudge
Dialogue: What's he doing here? And what's happened to him?

Speaker: Albus Dumbledore
Dialogue: Minister, you will order the removal of Dolores Umbridge from my school.

Speaker: Albus Dumbledore
Dialogue: Also, she will probably need medical attention, having had a violent encounter with some Centaurs earlier this evening.

Speaker: Albus Dumbledore
Dialogue: All Educational Decrees will be nullified and you will call off the search on Hagrid so he can return to work.

Speaker: Albus Dumbledore
Dialogue: I will return here later tonight, after I have seen to Harry. It should not take long.

Speaker: Albus Dumbledore
Dialogue: Portus.

Speaker: Cornelius Fudge
Dialogue: Dumbledore, I want some answers!

Speaker: Albus Dumbledore
Dialogue: The Second War has begun, Minister.

Speaker: Albus Dumbledore
Dialogue: Thank you...

Speaker: Albus Dumbledore
Dialogue: Please sit, Harry.

Speaker: Albus Dumbledore
Dialogue: I understand how you feel, Harry--

Speaker: Harry Potter
Dialogue: No you don't!

Speaker: Albus Dumbledore
Dialogue: You forget that Sirius was my friend too. You are not the only person on this earth capable of feelings, Harry.

Speaker: Albus Dumbledore
Dialogue: There is no shame in feeling pain, Harry. It is your greatest strength...

Speaker: Harry Potter
Dialogue: You don't have a clue! You can't possibly know!

Speaker: Albus Dumbledore
Dialogue: What can't I know?

Speaker: Albus Dumbledore
Dialogue: This pain is part of being human, Harry...

Speaker: Harry Potter
Dialogue: Then I don't want to be human!

Speaker: Harry Potter
Dialogue: I don't care! I don't care!

Speaker: Albus Dumbledore
Dialogue: You do care. You care so much you feel like you will bleed to death because of it.

Speaker: Harry Potter
Dialogue: Let me out.

Speaker: Albus Dumbledore
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: Harry Potter
Dialogue: You can't keep me in here!

Speaker: Albus Dumbledore
Dialogue: I daresay I can. And if you actually do attack me with that wand, Harry, I'm afraid to say you will regret it.

Speaker: Albus Dumbledore
Dialogue: It is my fault Sirius died tonight.

Speaker: Albus Dumbledore
Dialogue: I have kept things from you, harry. Things that I should not have concealed. You had a right to know but I put off telling you.

Speaker: Albus Dumbledore
Dialogue: Had I told you that voldemort might try to lure you down to the Department of Mysteries you would never have gone there tonight. Sirius would never have gone after you.

Speaker: Albus Dumbledore
Dialogue: That fault lies with me. I hope that you can find it in your heart to forgive me one day.

Speaker: Albus Dumbledore
Dialogue: Harry, I owe you this explanation, to show you the failings of an old man.

Speaker: Albus Dumbledore
Dialogue: Our explanation begins with your scar. You already know that it is a connection between you and Voldemort, and that this connect goes both ways.

Speaker: Albus Dumbledore
Dialogue: I grew worried that Voldemort would at some point discover this connection, which he did the night Mr.Weasely was attacked.

Speaker: Harry Potter
Dialogue: I already know all this.

Speaker: Albus Dumbledore
Dialogue: Haven't you wondered why I haven't spoken to you, even looked at you, for months?

Speaker: Harry Potter
Dialogue: Well, yeah, I did...

Speaker: Albus Dumbledore
Dialogue: I was worried that if Voldemort discovered there was a closer relationship between us than simply between teacher and student he would use you to spy the order another mistake.

Speaker: Albus Dumbledore
Dialogue: Voldemort showed us both tonight that his aim in possessing you would not be to destroy me, but to destroy you.

Speaker: Albus Dumbledore
Dialogue: Sirius told me you believed there was a snake inside of you. This was Voldemort attempting to manipulate you. To protect you from this, I had you study Occlumency.

Speaker: Harry Potter
Dialogue: But Snape stopped giving me lessons.

Speaker: Albus Dumbledore
Dialogue: Yes. I thought he could overcome his feelings towards your father, but I was wrong. Some wounds cut too deep to be healed.

Speaker: Harry Potter
Dialogue: He barely taught me, though. I always felt more open to it after the lessons. Like he was trying to open me to Voldemort—-

Speaker: Albus Dumbledore
Dialogue: I would trust Severus Snape with my life, Harry. You have never recovered from your mistrust of him in your first year.

Speaker: Harry Potter
Dialogue: Sirius didn't trust him. Didn't believe he'd really turned to our side...

Speaker: Albus Dumbledore
Dialogue: Again, some wounds run too deep to be healed, Harry. Severus and Sirius never liked each other at school. This has never changed.

Speaker: Albus Dumbledore
Dialogue: During your Occulumency lessons, Professor Snape discovered that you were dreaming about the door in the Department of Mysteries.

Speaker: Harry Potter
Dialogue: I've been dreaming about that all year, before Voldemort discovered the connection.

Speaker: Albus Dumbledore
Dialogue: Yes. Voldemort has been obsessed with hearing that prophesy since he returned. Because of your scar, what he was obsessed with, you were obsessed with, in the form of dreams.

Speaker: Albus Dumbledore
Dialogue: Once he discovered the connection, Voldemort had little difficulty in manipulating you into thinking he had captured Sirius.

Speaker: Harry Potter
Dialogue: But I checked Grimmauld Place! Kreacher said--

Speaker: Albus Dumbledore
Dialogue: Kreacher lied. He wanted you to go to the Department of Mysteries.

Speaker: Harry Potter
Dialogue: Why?

Speaker: Albus Dumbledore
Dialogue: Kreacher has been serving two masters for some months now.

Speaker: Harry Potter
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: Albus Dumbledore
Dialogue: It appears that when sirius told him to get out, Kreacher thought he meant out of the house. So he went to the black's closest relatives, the malfoys.

Speaker: Albus Dumbledore
Dialogue: Obviously, they questioned him. Sirius had forbidden him from giving up important secrets. But Sirius had neglected to mention his relationship with you

Speaker: Albus Dumbledore
Dialogue: He told them how you saw him as a mixture of father and brother, and that you would move heaven and earth to save Sirius.

Speaker: Albus Dumbledore
Dialogue: Voldemort sknew that making you velieve he had Sirius in the Department of Mysteries ould force you there.

Speaker: Harry Potter
Dialogue: Wait, where was Sirius when I tried to contact him?

Speaker: Albus Dumbledore
Dialogue: Ah. Apparently Kreacher had injured Buckbeak to distract him in case you tried to contact Headquarters.

Speaker: Albus Dumbledore
Dialogue: Sirius was tending to the wounds when you called.

Speaker: Harry Potter
Dialogue: And Hermione said we should be nice to Kreacher!

Speaker: Albus Dumbledore
Dialogue: She was quite right, Harry. Kreacher is what wizards have made him. He is to be pitied, not hated.

Speaker: Harry Potter
Dialogue: Sirius hated him.

Speaker: Albus Dumbledore
Dialogue: He didn't hate Kreacher himself. Kreacher was a reminder to Sirius of the home he had always hated.

Speaker: Harry Potter
Dialogue: Yeah, he really hated that place. And you kept him locked up in there!

Speaker: Albus Dumbledore
Dialogue: I was trying to save his life!

Speaker: Albus Dumbledore
Dialogue: It is time to tell you what I should have five years ago. No doubt you have wondered why it was that I sent you there and not to a wizarding family?

Speaker: Albus Dumbledore
Dialogue: I did it for your protection. You were in more danger than anyone realized. Voldemort was defeated, but his servants were everywhere.

Speaker: Albus Dumbledore
Dialogue: I also knew that Voldemort would return one day. I played to his weakness. There is an ancient magic which Voldemort has always underestimated.

Speaker: Albus Dumbledore
Dialogue: This magic is what your mother gave you when she died. That protection would only work, however, if you were cared for by a blood relative. Your Aunt, Petunia.

Speaker: Harry Potter
Dialogue: She never loved me.

Speaker: Albus Dumbledore
Dialogue: Perhaps not. But she took you in, however grudgingly. As long as you can call your Aunt's house your home, you are protected.

Speaker: Albus Dumbledore
Dialogue: And now we come to the moment of terrible truth, the moment I have dreaded for fifteen years. The moment when I must lay another burden atop your already straining shoulders.

Speaker: Albus Dumbledore
Dialogue: Do you remember your first year here? When you lay in the hospital wing fresh from your confrontation with Voldemort?

Speaker: Albus Dumbledore
Dialogue: Do you remember what you asked me that night?

Speaker: Harry Potter
Dialogue: I asked you why Voldemort tried to kill me.

Speaker: Albus Dumbledore
Dialogue: Yes. I decided not to tell you then. After all, eleven was too young for such burdens. The same went for twelve. But I was runningout of excuses by thirteen and fourteen. Do you see the flaw in my plan yet?

Speaker: Albus Dumbledore
Dialogue: I cared about you too much. I became more concerned with your happiness and well-being than with the truth and the lives it could save. That was my greatest mistake. It was exactly what Voldemort expects from us fools who love.

Speaker: Albus Dumbledore
Dialogue: But I could not bear to tell you. I have watched you pass through greater trials than any other student in the history of this school, and I could not bear to add another one, the grestest one of all.

Speaker: Albus Dumbledore
Dialogue: You have no idea the pain it causes me to tell it to you, even now. But unfortunately, I must.

Speaker: Harry Potter
Dialogue: I don't understand, Professor.

Speaker: Albus Dumbledore
Dialogue: The reason Voldemort tried to kill you is because of a prophesy made just before your bith. By attempting to kill you, he believed he was fulfilling the terms of the prophesy. Voldemort's mistake was that he had not heard the entire prophesy.

Speaker: Albus Dumbledore
Dialogue: That is the weapon we have been guarding, and which he has been so desperately seeking: the knowledge of how to destroy you.

Speaker: Harry Potter
Dialogue: Professor, why am I so important to him?

Speaker: Albus Dumbledore
Dialogue: An excellent question, Harry. The answer lies in the prophesy.

Speaker: Harry Potter
Dialogue: Sir, it got smashed.

Speaker: Albus Dumbledore
Dialogue: That was not the only place the Prophesy is preserved.

Speaker: Sybill Trelawney
Dialogue: "The One with the power to vanquish the Dark Lord approaches....Born to those who have thrise defied him, born as the Seventh Month dies… and the dark lord will mark him as his equal, but he will have a power the dark lord knows not… and either must die at the hand of the other for niether can live while the other survives.... The one with the power to vanquish the dark lord will be born as the seventh Month dies..."

Speaker: Harry Potter
Dialogue: I'm not sure I understand all that, sir...
